intro: Ornithogalum erichpaschei, commonly known as the Erichpäsche's star-of-Bethlehem, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in early spring.
